pageContext.claim: “Well, they're forcing money because they want to make, you know, we needed two and a half billion, and they want to give us eight and a half billion. So I said, I'll take it, I'll take it if you want to do that, we'll take it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump confidently predicted the federal government will have "a lot money left over" because Congress insisted on giving him four times more than he asked for to fight the coronavirus. Within weeks, Congress had to pass several bills, totaling trillions of dollars, to handle the economic fallout from the pandemic.
